request.description:
Invokes the Root URL of the connector server.
Should provide the connector config.
Currently works only without authentication which is strange.

    "consumer": "{{consumer-id}}",
    "provider": "{{provider-id}}",

    "end": "2021-12-31T07:11:13.569Z"
}

}

request.description:
Creates a fresh sample resource with a fixed id.
"sample" is not really used in the server model but validated in the JSON payload!
"samples" on the other hand should be used in the server model but invokes an error on the JSON side!

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!--

information regarding authorship.

See the LICENSE file(s) distributed with this work for
additional information regarding license terms.

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>net.catenax</groupId>
    <artifactId>data</artifactId>
    <version>latest</version>
    <name>Catena-X Test Data Module</name>
    <description>All code related to managing test data</description>
    <properties>
        <java.version>11</java.version>
        <maven.compiler.source>11</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>11</maven.compiler.target>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
			<groupId>com.microsoft.azure</groupId>
			<artifactId>azure-storage</artifactId>
			<version>8.6.6</version>
		</dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.json</groupId>
            <artifactId>json</artifactId>
            <version>20210307</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
    <build>
        <plugins>
        <plugin>
        <artifactId>maven-assembly-plugin</artifactId>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <phase>package</phase>
            <goals>
              <goal>single</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
        <configuration>
          <descriptorRefs>
            <descriptorRef>jar-with-dependencies</descriptorRef>
          </descriptorRefs>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>		
      </plugins> 
    </build>
</project>

item.name: Semantic Adapter

request.description: Returns greetings to make sure basic service connection works.

Returns the self-description of the attached IDS connector.
This helps to find out whether IDS connection is alive.

variable.description: Preconfigured or newly registered offer name (offer-tdm/offer-windchill)

request.description:
Interactively publishes a given offer (with all configured representations and sources) to the attached IDS connector.
Either uses the given "offer" parameter to take the configuration out of the system properties (and leave the body to an empty object)
Alternatively, you can give it a complete configuration object for the offer in the body.
the Adapter may also be configured as to do an "auto-publish" of all preconfigured offers on startup

Interactively publishes a given twin source to the attached twin registry.
Either uses the given "twin-source" parameter to take the configuration out of the system properties (and leave the body to an empty object)
Alternatively, you can give it a complete configuration object for the source in the body.
the Adapter may also be configured as to do an "auto-registration" of all preconfigured twin sources on startup

query.description: uses a fixed file source for debugging
uses a fixed transformation for debugging
uses a fixed transformation for debugging
uses a fixed transformation for debugging
a key part when addressing data inside the source/artifact
a key part when addressing data inside the source/artifact
a key part when addressing data inside the source/artifact

request.description:
The actual "pull" callback that is usually called by the IDS connector to satisfy negotiated data requests (represented by the "offer", "representation" and "source" parameters).  
It also has a "local-only" mode to directly investigate the data delivered from the backend systems (represented by the "file" and "transformation" parameters.

item.description:
The Semantic Adapter is a simple prototype of a middleware that connects backend systems (here: export files, database tables) to the IDS/Catena-X data backbone.

Needs Fraunhofer IDS Connector Version 6.

It currently supports only "PULL" offerings/data transfers via the builtin IDS connector

request.description: The anonymize endpoint maps original identifiers (URNs) into forgettable pseudonyms (URNs).

response.name: The response body contains the mapping to pseudonyms.

request.description: The forget endpoint forgets pseudonyms associated to original identifiers (URNs).

response.name: The response body contains the forget statistics.

request.description: The federation put endpoint starts a new federation

response.name: The response body contains the registered federation specification.

request.description: The defederation post endpoint ends an existing federation

response.name: The response body contains the deregistered federation specification.
